text: Achlya hoerburgeri is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Schawerda in 1924. It is found in the Russian Far East., 1924, Verhandlungen der zoologisch-botanischen Gesellschaft Wien 73: 90; pl. 1, fig. 18. The habitat consists of mixed and broad-leaved forests with oak.A review of the Thyatirin-moths (Lepidoptera, Drepanidae: Thyatirinae) of the Russian Far East ==References== Category:Moths described in 1924 Category:Thyatirinae Category:Moths of Russia
title: Achlya hoerburgeri
